raw_comment: I notice that older people tend to say that the world isn't getting better and most of the people who say this are younger. I wonder why most young people say that the world is getting better. I think this is because they like easier things and every generation to come, their life is easier. My parents didn't have phones, TVs, or video games. If they grew up like this they would know the truth. This relates to me because I see a lot of kids and young adults who are living in a lap of luxury. They would say the world is getting better (easier).  Is the world actually getting better?
ace_sentences: Older people tend to say that the world is not getting better.
Most people who say that the world is not getting better are older people.
I wonder why many young people say that the world is getting better.
Many young people say that the world is getting better.
I think that young people like easier things.
I think that the life of every future generation is easier.
My parents did not have phones.
My parents did not have TVs.
My parents did not have video games.
If young people grew up without phones and without TVs and without video games then young people would know the truth.
This relates to me.
I see many kids.
I see many young adults.
Many kids live in luxury.
Many young adults live in luxury.
Many kids say that the world is getting better.
Many young adults say that the world is getting better.
Many kids mean that the world is getting easier.
Many young adults mean that the world is getting easier.
I ask whether the world is actually getting better.
